title: Negative power prices set to persist in 2025 – consultancy
subtitle: (Montel) Spain could see a “fairly high” number of hours with negative power prices in 2025, in line with 2024, due to the sustained deployment of renewables capacity, consultancy Aurora Energy Research said on Wednesday.
body:
However, the firm did not expect prices to be “deeply negative”, given the limited number of bids in the market below EUR -3/MWh, said Christina Rentell, its head of research for Iberia and France, during a webinar.
Spain saw a total of 247 hours with negative power prices in 2024 and an average spot power price of EUR 63.03/MWh, as the country’s boom in renewable generation continued. 
Other analysts had already pointed to a likely continuation of negative prices this year, as the bullish impact of lower hydropower output would be offset by the 7.7 GW of new green capacity added in Spain last year. 
Further out, Spain could see a reduction in the frequency of negative prices from 2028 onwards with the addition of more flexibility infrastructure, such as batteries, according to Aurora Energy Research.
Although there were only 247 hours clearing at below-zero prices last year, 25% of the output bid by producers in Spain’s wholesale power market was at negative prices, said Javier Pamos, product manager at the company.
